content.html:
Students will complete the following questions to practice the skills they have learned in this lesson.

For questions 1–7, find the factored form of the quadratic expression.

  1. \(x^2+4x − 12\)
  • \((x − 2)(x − 6)\)
  • \((x + 3)(x − 4)\)
  • \((x + 2)(x − 6)\)
  • \((x − 2)(x + 6)\)

Answer: \((x − 2)(x + 6)\)

  1. \(x^2−3x −18\)
  • \((x − 9)(x + 2)\)
  • \((x − 6)(x + 3)\)
  • \((x − 18)(x + 1)\)
  • \((x − 7)(x + 3)\)

Answer: \((x − 6)(x + 3)\)

  1. \(x^2− 12x − 45\)
  • \((x − 45)(x + 1)\)
  • \((x − 8)(x − 4)\)
  • \((x − 9)(x + 5)\)
  • \((x − 15)(x + 3)\)

Answer: \((x − 15)(x + 3)\)

  1. \(x^2−x −20\)
  • \((x − 10)(x + 2)\)
  • \((x − 5)(x + 4)\)
  • \((x − 20)(x + 1)\)
  • \((x + 5)(x − 4)\)

Answer: \((x − 5)(x + 4)\)

  1. \(x^2+2x −35\)
  • \((x − 5)(x + 7)\)
  • \((x + 5)(x + 7)\)
  • \((x + 5)(x − 7)\)
  • \((x − 5)(x − 7)\)

Answer: \((x − 5)(x + 7)\)

  1. \(x^2−23x −50\)
  • \((x − 10)(x + 5)\)
  • \((x − 50)(x + 1)\)
  • \((x − 25)(x + 2)\)
  • \((x − 10)(x − 13)\)

Answer: \((x − 25)(x + 2)\)

  1. \(x^2+7x −60\)
  • \((x − 5)(x + 12)\)
  • \((x − 20)(x + 3)\)
  • \((x − 10)(x + 3)\)
  • \((x − 4)(x + 15)\)

Answer: \((x − 5)(x + 12)\)

  1. Consider the expression \(x^2+bx −80\), where the leading coefficient equals 1. Identify all the pairs of factors of –80 that would result in positive values of \(b\).
  • 80 and 1,
    40 and 2,
    20 and 4,
    16 and 5,
    10 and 8
  • –80 and 1,
    –40 and 2,
    –20 and 4,
    –16 and 5,
    –10 and 8
  • –80 and –1,
    –40 and –2,
    –20 and –4,
    –16 and –5,
    –10 and –8
  • 80 and –1,
    40 and –2,
    20 and –4,
    16 and –5,
    10 and –8

Answer: 80 and –1, 40 and –2, 20 and –4, 16 and –5, 10 and –8

  1. Consider the expression \(x^2+ bx − 80\), where the leading coefficient equals 1. Identify all the pairs of factors of –80 that would result in negative values of \(b\).
  • 80 and 1,
    40 and 2,
    20 and 4,
    16 and 5,
    10 and 8
  • –80 and 1,
    –40 and 2,
    –20 and 4,
    –16 and 5,
    –10 and 8
  • –80 and –1,
    –40 and –2,
    –20 and –4,
    –16 and –5,
    –10 and –8
  • 80 and –1,
    40 and –2,
    20 and –4,
    16 and –5,
    10 and –8

Answer: –80 and 1, –40 and 2, –20 and 4, –16 and 5, –10 and 8

  1. Identify the missing symbols:

\(x^2\; \square \; 15x \;\square\; 34\) and \((x + 2)(x − 17)\)

  • − and −
  • + and −
  • + and +
  • − and +

Answer: − and −
